content.description: Start on sloper jug to the left of static tang, climb up
content.location: kinder boulder far left if facing crab louse

content.description: A techy v4 with tough feet. Start sitting, do about three moves using superb footwork, and snag the jug. Finish by climbing up on the arete/ledge on the corner, and downclimbing from there.Pretty frustrating if you cannot keep your feet on. Really fun if you do.A good problem to do during bad weather, it stays dry almost all of the time.
content.location: On the far left side of the Kindergarten boulder, about five meters to the left of Crab Louse, v5/12b, on the same face.

content.description: Great warm up, start as far left as possible  and traverse all the way right, walking off on the edge on the far right side.Honestly a pretty high quality problem.  could be topped out, but if you aren’t sure, don’t do it. (That would probably make it V2+)
content.location: On the southernmost end of the Kindergarten Boulder (the side facing towards the cabins).

content.description: Giant boulder off of the main trail if you take the suspension bridge approach (it will be uphill on the right). Will be one of the eastern boulders on the hillside of the North Forty. Can't miss it!  Shady.
